hackathon-description-text: This weekend, HackUCI changes Orange County forever. This is 36 hours of intense learning and building concluding in an expo of awesome tech projects. Join us as we close the fall collegiate hackathon season in style!
hackathon-requirements: Make something you think is awesome!
hackathon-rules:
Entry materials/data that have been tampered with or altered are void. No responsibility is assumed for: (i) lost, late, misdirected, damaged, garbled, incomplete or illegible Entries, all of which are void; (ii) error, omission, interruption, deletion, defect, delay in operations or transmission, theft or destruction or unauthorized access to or alterations of Entry materials, or for technical, network, telephone equipment, electronic, computer, hardware or software malfunctions of any kind, or inaccurate transmission of or failure to receive entry information by Sponsor on account of technical problems or traffic congestion on the Internet or at any web site or any combination thereof; or (iii) any injury or damage to entrant’s or any other person’s computer related to or resulting from participating in the Contest.
Use of items including, but not limited to (i) soldering irons or other devices that can cause an open flame or fire and (ii) WiFi hotspots can result in the Team’s disqualification from the Contest and ejection from the event.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Oculus Rift DK2 (one for each team member, up to 4 members)
Create an all in one monthly recurring membership (like a gym) application using the Square Connect API.
Create an esports event/tournament management and bracket application.
Winners will receive a Cylance swag bag
Winners will receive an IOT (Internet of Things) Pack
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Microsoft Internet of Things Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Unity Pro Licenses (one for each team member, up to 5 members)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=120 W 5th St, Santa Ana, CA 92701, USA
